docs.snippet: The Commissioners of Health met at the City Hall on Monday. Previously to the meeting it was said it can now be proved that Miss Cross, Who died recently from yellow fever, visited one of the intected vessels below Townsends clock for the purpose, as...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners of Health met at the City Hall on Monday. Previously to the meeting it was said it can now be proved that Miss Cross, Who died recently from yellow fever, visited one of the intected vessels below Townsends clock for the purpose, as is alleged. of obtaining a draught of water.

headline.main: Letter from the Hon. Edward Everett.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the late gathering of the Massachusetts Historical Society at the house of Mr. FREDERIC TUDOR, at Nahant, the following letter was read from Mr. EVERETT: BOSTON, Tuesday, Aug. 10, 1858. MY DEAR MR. LIVERMORE: I have great pleasure, in compliance with the wish expressed in your note

docs.snippet: The President returned last night much improved in health. The Peace Commissioners, Messrs. POWELL and McCULLOOH, arrived Yesterday morning from Utah. Their representations of the present agreement be tween the Mormons and the Government do not vary...

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; INTERESTING FROM WASHINGTON. Arrival of the Utah Peace Commissioners--Their Opinion of Brigham Young and his Followers--The Indias Troubles in Washington and Oregon--Nicaraguas Affairs, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President returned last night much improved in health. The Peace Commissioners, Messrs. POWELL and McCULLOOH, arrived Yesterday morning from Utah. Their representations of the present agreement be tween the Mormons and the Government do not vary in any material points from what has already been published. The most important consideration

docs.snippet: By the brig Wm. Wilson, we have the Diario Rio de Janeiro of June 27. The Diario has a long article vigorously urging a " political alliance with the United States, which should extend even to the formation of a principle of intervention in such...
docs.lead_paragraph: By the brig Wm. Wilson, we have the Diario Rio de Janeiro of June 27. The Diario has a long article vigorously urging a " political alliance with the United States, which should extend even to the formation of a principle of intervention in such cases, and of such character as might be judged proper, in order to control the interests and protect the rights of the various States in the two Americas."
